author: The Wall Street Journal
description:
The bodies of Israeli hostages who remain in Gaza are at the center of a fragile cease-fire between Israel and Hamas. The U.S.-brokered ceasefire set clear terms: hostages and bodies would be returned, while Israel eased military operations and released Palestinian prisoners.  

WSJ follows two families on a journey for closure as the delicate truce hangs in the balance.

Chapters:
0:00 Israel-Hamas cease-fire
1:17 Ruby Chen’s son
2:23 The Haimi family’s efforts
3:32 U.S. efforts to return bodies to families 
5:18 A funeral

#Israel #Hamas #WSJ
title: ‘I Want a Funeral:’ Israeli Families at the Center of the Fragile Cease-Fire | WSJ

author: The Wall Street Journal
description: The U.S. sent B-1 bombers to the Caribbean just a week after flying B-52 bombers near Venezuela. WSJ’s Shelby Holliday explains how the Pentagon is stepping up its show of force.
title: Why the U.S. Is Flying Bombers Near Venezuela | WSJ News
